cta.title: Turn photos into links in seconds

longform.title: Why Photo To URL helps your workflow
longform.p1: Photo To URL is built for creators, marketers, support teams, founders, and anyone who needs a quick, reliable way to turn photos into clean links. With a direct upload-to-link flow, you avoid heavy media managers and skip logins. Links are tidy, easy to paste into chat apps, docs, wikis, bug reports, and tickets. Teams move faster when screenshots and product photos are instantly shareable without attachment limits or messy previews. Because the links are predictable and consistent, they also work well in automation, QA steps, and lightweight prototypes.
longform.p2: The experience stays simple: drop, paste, or browse; get a link; share. No extra chrome, no distracting ads, no gating. You keep focus on your content while we handle the boring parts of hosting. Whether you are documenting a feature, preparing a blog post, building a pitch deck, or sending a quick support response, a short link beats bulky attachments. For global teams, the interface is available in multiple languages while keeping copy concise and universal.

items.1: Product and design: share UI mocks, component screenshots, and quick visual notes without exporting to heavy tools.
items.2: Support and QA: attach reproducible screenshots in tickets, chat threads, or runbooks; links stay tidy and easy to track.
items.3: Docs and blogs: embed photos in Markdown, HTML, or CMS editors with predictable URLs and no layout surprises.
items.4: Sales and CS: drop proof-of-concept captures or customer walkthroughs straight into email or messaging.
items.5: Engineering handoff: keep build artifacts, error snaps, and regression visuals lightweight for faster reviews.
items.6: Community and socials: paste links into Discord, Slack, Teams, Twitter/X, or forums without bloated previews.

flow.title: How the flow works end-to-end
flow.p1: 1) Choose an image: drag-and-drop, paste from clipboard, or click to browse. PNG, JPG, WEBP, GIF up to 10MB are supported now. 2) We upload and return a direct link. The UI shows your URL immediately with copy, open, and multi-format save actions (.txt, .json, .md). 3) You reuse the link anywhere: blogs, docs, tickets, chat, prototypes. The goal is a frictionless bridge between your photo and the places you work.
flow.p2: Each step is tuned for clarity: visible status, friendly errors, and buttons that confirm actions. The copy button sits next to the link, and the save buttons let you keep the URL in your preferred format for bookmarking or automation. When R2 is enabled, links serve from the CDN domain; if the service is in maintenance, the UI returns a clear message instead of raw errors.

items.1: Keep filenames meaningful before upload; they remain part of the URL and help future search.
items.2: Use WEBP or optimized JPG/PNG for lighter payloads if you expect heavy sharing.
items.3: Copy the link directly after generation to avoid stale clipboard entries.
items.4: Save as .json when you need to batch store references for automation or audits.
items.5: Use .md output when embedding in docs or wikis; it is ready to paste.
items.6: Save as .txt for plain text links that are ready to copy and use.

roadmap.title: Roadmap highlights
roadmap.p1: Upcoming improvements include deeper Cloudflare R2 integration by default, more generous upload limits, optional auth for team spaces, and per-link analytics. We also plan preset link styles, one-click delete, and organization-level buckets. SEO polish continues across blog, docs, and status pages, with richer schema and a public sitemap for fast indexing.

1.a: Yes, core upload-to-link is free. CDN-backed hosting via R2 will roll out with generous tiers.

2.a: PNG, JPG, WEBP, GIF up to 10MB today. More formats can be added based on demand.

3.q: Can I embed in Markdown or HTML?
3.a: Yes. Copy the link as-is, or use the one-click .txt / .json / .md saves for drop-in snippets.

4.q: Do you keep my files public?
4.a: Links are shareable; when R2 CDN is enabled, they are served via the CDN domain. We show clear maintenance messages if storage is unavailable.

5.q: Will there be accounts or teams?
5.a: Planned. We prioritize frictionless uploads first, then add team spaces, access control, and analytics.

seo.title: Privacy Policy | Photo To URL
seo.description: Privacy Policy for Photo To URL - Learn how we collect, use, and protect your data.

page.title: Privacy Policy
page.introduction: At Photo To URL, we respect your privacy and are committed to protecting your personal information. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use our service.

dataCollection.title: Information We Collect
dataCollection.content1: When you upload an image, we collect:
dataCollection.item1: The image file you upload (stored temporarily to generate a shareable link)
dataCollection.item3: IP address (for rate limiting and security purposes)
dataCollection.content2: We do not collect personal information such as your name, email address, or phone number unless you voluntarily provide it through our contact form.

dataUsage.title: How We Use Your Information
dataUsage.item1: To generate and provide shareable image links
dataUsage.item2: To prevent abuse and enforce upload limits
dataUsage.item3: To improve our service and user experience

dataStorage.title: Data Storage and Retention
dataStorage.content: Uploaded images are stored on Cloudflare R2 storage. We retain images for as long as necessary to provide the service. Images may be deleted automatically after a period of inactivity or due to policy violations.

cookies.title: Cookies and Tracking Technologies
cookies.item1: Local Storage: To store your upload history and language preferences
cookies.item2: Google AdSense: For displaying advertisements (uses cookies for ad personalization)
cookies.item3: Yandex Metrika: For website analytics (anonymized data)
cookies.content2: You can control cookies through your browser settings. However, disabling cookies may affect some functionality of our service.

thirdParty.title: Third-Party Services
thirdParty.content1: We use the following third-party services:
thirdParty.item1: Cloudflare R2: For image storage and CDN delivery
thirdParty.item2: Google AdSense: For advertising (subject to Google's Privacy Policy)
thirdParty.item3: Yandex Metrika: For website analytics (subject to Yandex's Privacy Policy)
thirdParty.content2: These services may collect information in accordance with their own privacy policies. We encourage you to review their privacy policies.

dataSecurity.title: Data Security
dataSecurity.content: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your data against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction. However, no method of transmission over the Internet is 100% secure.

yourRights.title: Your Rights
yourRights.item1: Access your uploaded images and associated data
yourRights.item3: Opt-out of certain data collection practices

children.title: Children's Privacy
children.content: Our service is not intended for children under 13 years of age. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 13.

changes.title: Changes to This Privacy Policy
changes.content: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page and updating the "Last Updated" date.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.text: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer

seo.title: Cookie Policy | Photo To URL
seo.description: Cookie Policy for Photo To URL - Learn about how we use cookies and tracking technologies.

page.title: Cookie Policy
page.introduction: This Cookie Policy explains how Photo To URL uses cookies and similar tracking technologies when you visit our website. By using our service, you consent to the use of cookies in accordance with this policy.

whatAreCookies.title: What Are Cookies
whatAreCookies.content: Cookies are small text files that are placed on your device when you visit a website. They are widely used to make websites work more efficiently and provide information to website owners.

howWeUseCookies.title: How We Use Cookies
howWeUseCookies.content: We use cookies for the following purposes:
howWeUseCookies.item1: To store your upload history and language preferences
howWeUseCookies.item2: To analyze website traffic and user behavior

essential.title: Essential Cookies
essential.content: These cookies are necessary for the website to function properly. They enable core functionality such as storing your language preferences and upload history.

analytics.title: Analytics Cookies
analytics.content: We use Yandex Metrika to analyze how visitors use our website. These cookies collect anonymous information about website usage to help us improve our service.

advertising.title: Advertising Cookies
advertising.content: We use Google AdSense to display advertisements. These cookies help deliver personalized ads based on your browsing behavior and interests.

thirdPartyCookies.title: Third-Party Cookies
thirdPartyCookies.content: We use the following third-party services that may set cookies:
thirdPartyCookies.item1: Google AdSense - For advertising (subject to Google's Privacy Policy)
thirdPartyCookies.item2: Yandex Metrika - For website analytics (subject to Yandex's Privacy Policy)

manageCookies.title: Managing Cookies
manageCookies.content: You can control and manage cookies through your browser settings. Most browsers allow you to refuse or accept cookies, delete existing cookies, or set preferences for certain websites. However, disabling cookies may affect the functionality of our service.

changes.title: Changes to This Cookie Policy
changes.content: We may update this Cookie Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Cookie Policy on this page and updating the "Last Updated" date.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.text: If you have questions about this Cookie Policy, please contact us at

bookmarklet.title: Photo To URL Bookmarklet
bookmarklet.description: Upload images from any webpage directly to Photo To URL with a single click!

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.step2: Click the bookmarklet in your bookmarks bar
howItWorks.step3: Select an image from the page
howItWorks.step4: Get the URL instantly and copy it!

step1.title: Step 1: Copy the Bookmarklet Code
step1.description: Click the button below to copy the bookmarklet code to your clipboard.

step2.title: Step 2: Add to Your Browser
step2.description: Follow these steps based on your browser:
step2.chrome: Chrome/Edge: Press Ctrl+Shift+B (Cmd+Shift+B on Mac) to show the bookmarks bar, then right-click it and select "Add page". Paste the code as the URL.
step2.firefox: Firefox: Right-click the bookmarks bar and select "New Bookmark". Paste the code as the Location.
step2.safari: Safari: Enable the bookmarks bar (View → Show Bookmarks Bar), then drag the code to the bookmarks bar.
step2.edge: Alternative: Create a new bookmark, edit it, and replace the URL with the copied code.

step3.title: Step 3: Start Using It!
step3.description: Visit any webpage with images and click your bookmarklet to start uploading!

usage.title: Features
usage.description: The bookmarklet provides the following features:
usage.feature1: Select any image from the current webpage
usage.feature2: Automatic upload to Photo To URL
usage.feature3: Get a shareable URL instantly with one-click copy

note.title: Note
note.content: The bookmarklet works on most websites. Some sites with strict security policies (CORS) may prevent image uploads.
